controller

Class RestaurantController

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • controller.RestaurantController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig

    @WebServlet(name="RestaurantController",
            urlPatterns="/RestaurantController")
public class RestaurantController
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet

      • update

        public boolean update(java.lang.String monToFryOt,
                      java.lang.String monToFryCt,
                      java.lang.String satOt,
                      java.lang.String satCt,
                      java.lang.String sunOt,
                      java.lang.String sunCt,
                      int totalNumberOfSeats,
                      java.lang.String contactNumber,
                      java.lang.String email)
               throws java.text.ParseException,
                      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                      java.sql.SQLException
        updates restaurant data
        Parameters:
        monToFryOt - the opening time that goes from monday to friday
        monToFryCt - the closing time that goes from monday to friday
        satOt - saturday opening time
        satCt - saturday closing time
        sunOt - sunday opening time
        sunCt - sunday closing time
        totalNumberOfSeats - the number of seats of the restaurant
        contactNumber - the contact number of the restaurant
        email - the email of the restaurant
        Returns:
        true if update operation is completed
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        java.sql.SQLException

      • signup

        public boolean signup(java.lang.String email,

                      java.lang.String restaurantName,
                      java.lang.String addressLine1,
                      java.lang.String area,
                      java.lang.String postCode,
                      java.lang.String contactNumber,
                      java.lang.String foodType,
                      int totalNumberOfSeats)
               throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                      java.sql.SQLException
        creates a restaurant account into the db
        Parameters:
        email - the email of the restaurant
        password - the password of the restaurant
        restaurantName - the restaurant name
        addressLine1 - the address of the restaurant
        area - the area where the restaurant is situated
        postCode - the post code of the restaurant
        contactNumber - the contact number of the restaurant
        foodType - the food type the restaurant sells
        totalNumberOfSeats - the total number of seats of the restaurant
        Returns:
        true if the data is correct
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        java.sql.SQLException
